content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #164

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Request for Websocket to be officially supported, to enable Single Page Applications to use FHIRcast.

Submitted by Ron Parker on behalf of Kenn Sinn
HL7 Canada (ken.sinn@ehealthontario.on.ca )
Chapter/section: Security Considerations
Url: http://fhircast.org/security-considerations/#experimental-websockets-support
Type: A-S Enhancement
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary: Request for Websocket to be officially supported, to enable Single Page Applications to use FHIRcast.

Comment: The prescribed model for intent verification only works for server based architecture due to the fact that you cannot post to a single page app. In order to support single page app FHIRcast should support websocket as it is supported in the sandbox project. Can this be an officially supported feature of FHIRcast?

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #164

isaacvetter commented on Issue #164

Resolution: Considered for future use

Websocket support is critical path for FHIRcast, we still need more implementer feedback and experience. Following STU1 ballot, will publish #57 and specifically test websocket support at connectathon in Sept.

Mover: Isaac, Will
Affirmative, Abstaintion, Negative: 14-0-0

wmaethner labeled Issue #164

Comment: The prescribed model for intent verification only works for server based architecture due to the fact that you cannot post to a single page app. In order to support single page app FHIRcast should support websocket as it is supported in the sandbox project. Can this be an officially supported feature of FHIRcast?

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

isaacvetter commented on Issue #164:

Kenn, we agree!

We're working hard on a websockets spec to quickly follow this STU1.

Check out https://github.com/HL7/fhircast-docs/wiki/Websocket-proposal

The Sept connectathon is intended to support and encourage exactly this use-case.

Getting through our STU1 ballot is a pre-req for adding websocket support, so, I'm closing this issue. Please feel free to reach out.

Isaac
